instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message: Hello guys. This is a third party repair for another store that I'm doing here. The board has been UC on the other store before coming here, so probably it got liquid damaged and that's why they cleaned it. The symptom is that the machine works without battery, charger goes green/orange and works well. As soon as I plug in the battery it dies. No light on charger and the charger itself gets disabled by the board and only works again if I unplug and plug it in the wall again without battery connected. Verified <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/7152 and both are ok. Replaced ISL and reballed SMC. Same results. What else can I check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> exact voltage without battery connected?
I suspect <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message: I did not measure PPBUS before, but it's giving 15.91V(!!!!). Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, voltage dropped to around 10V, still very high for this board and the MOSFET gets REALLY hot! Maybe ISL got damaged also because of the bad FET?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message: Replaced. Same thing. I think <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> fried again. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> acting like a roller coaster and board does not turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message: Replaced both. Board turned on again, but <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is boiling hot and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is above 12V and fluctuating up and down like hell.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message: Trace from Pin 24 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> to Pin1 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was broken. Ran a jumper and now I have stable 8.59V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, but the board won't power on anymore.

Will try measuring, as I don't have an oscilloscope.

<SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> - 0.413V
<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL> - 3.326V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC</SIGNAL> - 1.318V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dies When Battery Connected
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C1303</CAPACITOR> was with low impedance. Replaced it and board worked!
